org.perfidix.ouput.asciitable

Class Util

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.perfidix.ouput.asciitable.Util

  • public final class Util
extends Object
    Utilities for the ascii table.

    • Method Detail

      • combine

        protected static String combine(String... args)
        Combines an unknown number of Strings to one String.
        Parameters:
        args - multiple Strings
        Returns:
        the combined string

      • pad

        protected static String pad(String data,
         char doPadWithThis,
         int totalWidth,
         AbstractTabularComponent.Alignment orientation)
        This method fills one char either on the right site of a given string or on the left site or on both sites. Refer to the example below. 
          pad ("hello",'-',11,NiceTable.LEFT);
  results in "hello------"
  pad("hello",'/',11,NiceTable.RIGHT);
  results in "//////hello";
  pad("hello",'.',11,NiceTable.CENTER);
  results in "...hello..."
        Parameters:
        doPadWithThis - the string to pad the string with
        data - the data to pad
        orientation - which orientation to take
        totalWidth - the total width of the result string
        Returns:
        padded string

      • implode

        protected static String implode(String glue,
             String[] what)
        Concantenate a String array "what" with glue "glue".
        Parameters:
        what - the array of strings to concantenate
        glue - the glue string to use. 
         String[] what = {
     "a", "b", "c"
 };
 
 String s = Util.implode("-", what);
 // result is "a-b-c"
        Returns:
        String

      • repeat

        protected static String repeat(String toBeRepeated,
            int numTimes)
        a str_repeat function.
        Parameters:
        toBeRepeated - the string to repeat
        numTimes - how many times to concantenate the string
        Returns:
        the repeated string.

      • containsNewlines

        public static boolean containsNewlines(String toExamine)
        Tells us whether the string contains newlines. it's important to note that only newlines within the string are important, not the newlines at the front or the end of the string.
        Parameters:
        toExamine - to be checked
        Returns:
        boolean if the string contains newlines.

      • createMatrix

        public static String[][] createMatrix(String[] data)
        Creates a matrix according to the number of new lines given into the method.
        Parameters:
        data - an array of row data
        Returns:
        the matrix.
